TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed MembershipCreateStatus extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Describes the result of a operation.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateStatus> enumeration indicates the success or failure of an attempt to create a new user. If the <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.CreateUser%2A> operation fails, the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateStatus> enumeration describes the cause of the failure.
> [!NOTE] > If you are not familiar with the membership features of ASP.NET, see [Introduction to Membership](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/79184d17-f4c7-4c9f-a073-cec4f5543980) before continuing. For a list of other topics related to membership, see [Managing Users by Using Membership](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/824c3a24-f0af-427c-a652-0d2d1e9397cd).
If you use a <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.CreateUser%2A> method overload that does not specify an output parameter of type <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateStatus>, an unsuccessful attempt to create a new user throws a <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException> with the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException.StatusCode%2A> property set to one of the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateStatus> enumeration values.
## Examples The following code example creates a new user for an ASP.NET application configured to use forms authentication and ASP.NET membership. If the user is not created successfully, a message is displayed to the user. If the user is created successfully, the user is redirected to the login page for the application. This code example uses the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateStatus> enumeration to determine the message displayed to the user in the event of a failure.
<!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-csharp[System.Web.Security.SqlMembershipProvider#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Security.SqlMembershipProvider/CS/CreateUsercs.aspx#2)] --> <!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-vb[System.Web.Security.SqlMembershipProvider#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Security.SqlMembershipProvider/VB/CreateUservb.aspx#2)] -->

Docs.summary: The e-mail address already exists in the database for the application.

Docs.summary: The provider user key already exists in the database for the application.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateStatus DuplicateUserName = int32(6)

Docs.summary: The user name already exists in the database for the application.

Docs.summary: The provider user key is of an invalid type or format.

Docs.summary: The password question is not formatted correctly.

Docs.summary: The user name was not found in the database.

Docs.summary: The provider returned an error that is not described by other enumeration values.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateStatus Success = int32(0)

Docs.summary: The user was not created, for a reason defined by the provider.
